pr_title: KEYCLOAK-12799 Missing Cancel button on The WebAuthn setup AIA

timeline.message: KEYCLOAK-12799 Missing Cancel button on The WebAuthn setup screen when using AIA
KEYCLOAK-12799 Missing Cancel button on The WebAuthn setup screen when using AIA

timeline.bodyText: Will it makes sense to move this to method "createCommonAttributes" and remove the very same block from "createResponse" so that it is not same code duplicated on 2 places?
timeline.author: mposolda

replies.bodyText: Yes, it will be better. Thanks!
replies.author: mabartos

timeline.bodyText: I think there is a need to use AuthServerRemoteExclude annotation here as well, due the test uses some runOnServer stuff...
timeline.author: mposolda

timeline.bodyText:
AFAIK with this assume, the test will be never executed anywhere. I guess we have 2 options:

If test currently doesn't require active WebAuthn support and will work by default with HtmlUnit and all the other browsers without WebAuthn support (which seems so), then we can remove the assume for now, so the test is executed in travis, pipeline and all the other places
Otherwise we can add it to different package etc, so that it is executed in the pipeline during running of WebAuthn tests.
timeline.author: mposolda

replies.bodyText: I would choose the second option, because the test, lately, should verify functionality of the WebAuthn AIA and the WebAuthn feature will be necessary.
replies.author: mabartos
